message_1: Simplify the rational expression (4x^2 - 16x + 12)/(2x^3 - 10x^2) as much as possible.
message_2:
First, we can factor out the common factors in both the numerator and the denominator.

Numerator:
4x^2 - 16x + 12
Factor out 4:
4(x^2 - 4x + 3)

Denominator:
2x^3 - 10x^2
Factor out 2x^2:
2x^2(x - 5)

Now our expression looks like this:
(4(x^2 - 4x + 3))/(2x^2(x - 5))

Next, we can factor the quadratic expression in the numerator:

x^2 - 4x + 3
(x - 3)(x - 1)

So now our expression is:
(4(x - 3)(x - 1))/(2x^2(x - 5))

There are no common factors in the numerator and denominator, so this is the simplified form of the rational expression:

(4(x - 3)(x - 1))/(2x^2(x - 5))
